history.text: Have you seen the Blind Side?
I have not, what is the movie about?

It is based on a true story about
 Michael Oher. do you know who that is?
I love movies based on true stories, I don't know who Michael Oher is, who is he?

He played football for the Baltimore Ravens. He was adopted by a couple when he was in high school and the movie follows his journey
.
Wow, who stars in the movie?
Sandra Bullock and Time McGraw are the big names in the film.
I love Sandra Bullock! Did the movie receive any awards?
I am not sure if the movie won awards, but did you know a book was originally written about Michael Oher's story?
That's very interesting, is it a comedy or a drama?
It would be considered a drama! Do you usually watch dramas?
I sometimes do, especially when they are based on true stories or involving sports.
My favorite scene of the movie is when Michael meets SJ (his parents later adopt Michael). It is a very heartwarming movie but I believe you would enjoy it based on the topic alone.
I think I will go see this film, it sounds like a film I would enjoy.
I am surprised Rotten Tomatoes scored the movie a 69%, as many major movie critics gave it great reviews.
Wow I can't believe that! Is it a good movie for a date night?

Yes, Michael Oher's story about being taken from his drug-addict mother when he was
seven and that no one knows her whereabouts is a heavy topic but it would be nice to watch with a significant other.
That sounds great, what is the rating?

Metacritic Score: 53/100
CinemaScore: A+
Im surprised the ratings are so inconsistent.
Yes me too! Is this movie suitable for kids?

Yes, a lot of lessons about judgement are served throughout the film. Especially, when a family friend suggests a daughter of Michael's adopted family would not be safe around him. The mother dismisses the rude friend and defends Michael, as this woman does not know anything about him or his character
. This lesson is important to teach tp kids.
That sounds great, my children and I should watch this movie.

The most heartwarming part of the movie is when Michael commits to Ole Miss (where his adoptive parents went) and tells the head coach Granger he chose Ole Miss because "it's where my family goes to school".
That sounds like a very good part of the movie!
Great to watch with the whole family.
What is the parental rating for this movie?
I could not answer that question! Im sure that is readily accessible on the internet.
I'll look that up right away!

uid1response.feedback: It sounds like a great movie that I can watch on a date night or with my children.
